citeinfo.origin: National Park Service Geologic Resources Evaluation (GRE) program.
citeinfo.title: Geologic Cross Section Lines of Biscayne National Park and Vicinity, Florida (NPS, GRE, BISC, BISCSEC)

citeinfo.origin: National Park Service Geologic Resources Evaluation (GRE) program.
citeinfo.title: Digital Geologic Map of Biscayne National Park

descript.abstract: The Geologic Cross Section Lines of Biscayne National Park and Vicinity, Florida data (BISCSEC) consists of geologic cross section lines. The data were completed as a component of the Geologic Resources Evaluation (GRE), a National Park Service (NPS) Inventory and Monitoring (I&M) funded program that is administered by the NPS Geologic Resources Division (GRD). The spatial data (coverage/theme) was produced from a georeferenced .TIF image (300dpi) of the source map from a paper copy. The coverage/theme (BISCSEC) was attributed as per the NPS GIS-Geology Data Model. An indexed ArcInfo .E00 (export) coverage file and an ArcView 3.X .SHP theme were then also created. The coverage/theme is within the area of interest of Biscayne National Park. The coverage/theme is in NAD83, UTM Zone 17N.
descript.purpose: Data intended to assist NPS personnel in the protection and management of Biscayne National Park.
descript.supplinf: The Geologic Cross Section Lines of Biscayne National Park and Vicinity, Florida coverage/theme (BISCSEC) is a component of the Digital Geologic Map of Biscayne National Park. Other coverages/themes that comprise the Digital Geologic Map of Biscayne National Park include: BISCGLG (area geologic units and contacts), BISCSUR (surficial geologic units and contacts), BISCBEN (benthic habitat units and contacts), BISCHZA (area geologic hazards), and BISCMIN (mine and mine related point features). Two accessory data tables, BISCGLG1 (accessory geologic unit data) and BISCMAP (source map information), are also considered map components.

idinfo.useconst: Not for use at scale greater than 1:675,000 (source map scale).
idinfo.datacred: Anne R. Poole, Heather Stanton and the Florida Geological Survey, U.S. Geological Survey

attracc.attraccr: Attribution was derived and checked by visual comparison of data with a copy of the published USGS source map. Users of this data are advised to FULLY and CAREFULLY READ the "DISTRIBUTION LIABILITY" section of this metadata before using the data.

dataqual.complete: Data is considered complete to the extent of the published USGS source map.

horizpa.horizpar: Data, captured from georeferenced .TIF image (300dpi) of the source map, is assumed to meet National Map Accuracy Standards. The PRECISION of the ArcInfo coverage .E00/ArcView .SHP theme file is DOUBLE.

srcinfo.srccontr: All geologic contact and map boundary arcs were produced from inherited data produced by the Florida Geological Survey. A paper copy of the published FGS source map was used to attribute features, as per the NPS GIS-Geology Data Model, and to check attribute and positional accuracy of the data.

A copy of the published USGS source map was used to attribute features, as per the NPS GIS-Geology Data Model, and to check attribute and positional accuracy of the data.

procstep.procdesc: Geologic cross section line arcs were captured (digitized) from georeferenced .TIF images (300dpi) of the source maps scanned from paper copies. The georeferenced images were in NAD83, UTM projection. The coordinates of this georeferenced image were in meters. The arc features were captured in ArcMap 8.3 in an ArcGIS Personal Geodatabase. The geodatabase was then converted to an ArcInfo coverage (BISCSEC) using ArcToolbox. Coverage topology (ArcInfo BUILD command) was then constructed and NPS GIS-Geology Data Model attribute fields added (ArcInfo ADDITEM command). Data Model attribution was derived and checked using a copy of the published USGS source map. If needed, the data were then 're-projected' (ArcInfo PROJECT command) into NAD83, UTM Zone 17N. An indexed (ArcInfo INDEX command) ArcInfo .E00 (export) coverage file and an ArcView 3.X .SHP theme were then also created.
procstep.srcused: published USGS and FGS source maps scale)

cntperp.cntorg: National Park Service, Geologic Resources Division

procstep.procdesc: The data were imported into a geodatabase and topology was used to check for errors between and within data layers. Topological errors were fixed and the data was exported to coverages, corrected to the data model and converted to shapefiles.

distinfo.resdesc: BISCGRE.ZIP (ArcInfo coverages) or BISCGRS.ZIP (ArcView .SHP theme files)
distinfo.distliab:
The National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such.
The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data.
The National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an NPS server and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the National Park Service, no warranty, expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies to both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.
